meanings.sent1: Connor is a popular name for boys.
meanings.sent2: My friend's brother is named Connor.
meanings.sent3: Connor always gets confused when someone calls his name in a crowded room.
meanings.sent4: In the story, Connor was the brave hero who saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The name Connor reminds me of a strong and reliable person.

meanings.sent1: Be careful, some people may try to connor you into giving them money.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he was trying to connor her with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his skills to connor the audience into believing he had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could connor anyone into thinking she was innocent.
meanings.sent5: The scam artist tried to connor the old man out of his life savings.

meanings.definition: A person who cons or deceives others.
meanings.sent1: The connor tricked many people with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the connor of the town, always coming up with new schemes.
meanings.sent3: The connor thought he could outsmart everyone, but he was eventually caught.
meanings.sent4: He was a connor by nature, always looking for ways to cheat others.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the connor who pretends to be your friend but has ulterior motives.
